### Lecture 16 - Unsupervised Machine Learning

#### Add possibility for the user to specify number of classes in the data ...

Do you know how to modify ShinyApp in a way that user can specify number of groups the data should be sorted?
Preferrably start from solution obtained from the Lecture 15

```{r, eval=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=TRUE}
# in ui.R
library(shiny)
 column(4, numericInput(inputId = "numClasses", label = "Select Number of Classes",
                                                      value = 2, min = 1, max = 4, step = 1))

# in server.R

# created reactive value
Classes <- reactive({input$numClasses})

# used this value in the clustering section of code

      if(!input$scaled) {
        KM <- KM1 %>% 
          kmeans(centers = Classes(), nstart = 20)
      } else {
        KM <- KM1 %>% 
          scale() %>%
          as.data.frame() %>%
          kmeans(centers = Classes(), nstart = 20)
      }

# of course it can be done as well without creating reactive value...
      if(!input$scaled) {
        KM <- KM1 %>% 
          kmeans(centers = input$numClasses, nstart = 20)
      } else {
        KM <- KM1 %>% 
          scale() %>%
          as.data.frame() %>%
          kmeans(centers = input$numClasses, nstart = 20)
      }
```
